algorithm_technique: Direct comparison of string lengths and content.
problem_summary_simple: Find the length of the longest subsequence unique to one of two strings.
problem_summary_technical: If strings are identical, no uncommon subsequence exists (-1). Otherwise, the longer string is the longest uncommon subsequence.
key_insights: An uncommon subsequence is a subsequence of one string but not the other.
If `a == b`, any subsequence of `a` is also a subsequence of `b`, so no uncommon subsequence exists.

If `a != b`, the longer string itself is a subsequence of itself but cannot be a subsequence of the shorter string (unless they are identical, which is handled). Thus, the longer string is an uncommon subsequence.
